text: Roy Alfred Roper (born 11 August 1923) is a former New Zealand rugby union player. A three-quarter, Roper represented Taranaki at a provincial level, and was a member of the New Zealand national side, the All Blacks, from 1949 to 1950. He played five matches for the All Blacks, all of them internationals. He later served as treasurer of the Taranaki Rugby Football Union from 1952 to 1971. During World War II, Roper served overseas with the Royal New Zealand Navy and appeared in six matches for the New Zealand Services XV in England. Since the death of Ron Elvidge in 2019, Roper has held the distinction of being the oldest living All Black. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:Living people Category:People from Manawatū-Whanganui Category:People educated at New Plymouth Boys' High School Category:Royal New Zealand Navy personnel of World War II Category:New Zealand rugby union players Category:New Zealand international rugby union players Category:Taranaki rugby union players Category:Rugby union three-quarters Category:New Zealand sports executives and administrators
